com.safety4kids.game.Screens

Class Level2Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.safety4kids.game.Screens.GameScreen
      • com.safety4kids.game.Screens.Level2Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class Level2Screen
extends GameScreen
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    This class plays the second level. It is essentially a safety quiz where the user has 4 lives. They lose lives for getting incorrect answers, and gains lives for getting the correct answer.
    Background borrowed from source site (2017-09-10) by artist: Jatashankar Kumar

    Course info:

    ICS4U with V. Krasteva
    Author:
    Bill Bai, Erfan Yeganehfar

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • loadQuestions

        public void loadQuestions()
        This method loads all questions, answers, and questionhelp into the respective lists,

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Thisis the render method. It uses a switch statement to decide which part of the program to run.
        Case RUN: Runs the quiz normally.
        Case NEXT_LEVEL: Calls dispose() and sets scene to next level.
        Case RESUME: Pauses the program to display question help. Then resumes the program when user presses space.
        Case LOSE: Sets scene to lose scene.
        Case RETURN: Sets scene to main menu
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Specified by:
        render in class GameScreen
        Parameters:
        delta - The target frame rate minus the time taken to complete this frame is called the delta time, used to keep the frames consistant across platforms.

      • shuffleAnswers

        private void shuffleAnswers()
        This method uses SEARCHING. It implements a sequential search to find the correct answers, after being shuffled.

      • drawQuestions

        private void drawQuestions(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        This method draws questions onto the screen.
        Parameters:
        batch - The SpriteBatch to be drawn on.

      • win

        private void win()
        This method is called when the user gets the correct answer. It adds a life and draws CORRECT onto the screen

      • lose

        private void lose()
        This method is called when the user gets the wrong answer. It decreases a life and draws WRONG onto the screen

      • displayQuestionHelp

        private void displayQuestionHelp()
        This method is only called during pause. It display's the question's tips.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method disposes the level's objects when it's done running, to save memory usage.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Specified by:
